definition: to get rid of/to put aside/to reject/to keep control/to hold (one's breath)

sentences.english: There will be a "one screen for all, " Kelly says.
sentences.chinese: 凱利稱未來將會有張顯視屏包含了所有。

sentences.english: The "reality TV" is a new kind entertainment on telescreen .
sentences.chinese: 真人秀是近年來在電視屏幕上興起的新的娛樂形式。
那蘋果爲什麼要有視屏呢？

sentences.english: This is a video simulation software tutorial, very good, and want to help you.
sentences.chinese: 這是仿真軟件的視屏教程，很好用，希望對你有幫助。

sentences.english: He swiveled his chair round to face the TV screen.
sentences.chinese: 他把椅子旋轉過來對著電視屏幕。

sentences.english: Jack gawks at the TV thinking.
sentences.chinese: 傑克呆呆看着電視屏幕，想着心事。

sentences.english: He watched the television and didn’t look at Kiah or Rilla.
sentences.chinese: 只見他注視着電視屏幕，根本不看凱和瑞拉。

sentences.english: Prey stationed herself in front of a large TV screen to watch the flight.
sentences.chinese: 食餌駐紮在一個大的電視屏幕前觀看自己的飛行。

sentences.english: He stared at the TV screen without even blinking.
sentences.chinese: 他的眼睛一眨也不眨的盯着電視屏幕看。

sentences.english: Eventually we'll have holographic images bursting out of your TV.
sentences.chinese: 最終，我們將使全息影像在電視屏幕上噴薄而出。

sentences.english: Finally, for everyone to see a screen, China expert show of migrant workers dance.
sentences.chinese: 最後，給大家看一段視屏，中國達人秀的民工舞蹈。

sentences.english: Video timecode in lower right corner.
sentences.chinese: 視屏的時間記錄在右下角。

sentences.english: With a TV screen, you can keep all or mostof the lights on.
sentences.chinese: 有了電視屏幕，你就可以打開大部分的燈光。
電視屏幕上的圖像變得模糊了。

sentences.english: Sometimes I watch a television screen.
So I watch  more movies at home, on my TV screen.
sentences.chinese: 因此，我在家裏的電視屏幕上看了更多電影。

definition: The Shining (1980 Stanley Kubrick film from Stephen King's 1977 novel)/ChthoniC (Taiwanese metal band)
pattern matching (puzzle game)/matching (type of test question in which presented items are to be paired up)
online game/abbr. for 網絡遊戲|网络游戏
barrage (military)/"bullet screen", function which allows viewers to post on-screen comments in videos, movies etc in real time/danmaku (video game subgenre)
time of day exactly on the hour (i.e. 12:00, 1:00 etc)/to make an inventory/(math.) point that has integer coordinates
opening titles (of movie)/leader (blank film at the beginning and end of a reel)
derailment/to jump the track (of train)/to derail
